job_description: Description of Organization/Department:Vancouver Coastal Health, one of British Columbia's five regional health authorities, serveapproximately 25% of BC's population. We provide a range of healthcare services includingprimary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary care, home and community care, mental healthservices, population and preventative health and addictions services.The Decision Support department delivers operational, clinical and information support tothe Senior Executive Team and other VCH decision makers to achieve short term and long termsustainability and to optimize healthcare across VCH. The Decision Support Team is composedof two primary functional areas:Data Management  Reporting, which includes data warehousing and analyticsSystem Improvement Data Release ManagementScope and Key Features/Responsibilities/Duties:We are looking for someone to help with some of the technical aspects of our currentprojects.  The successful candidate should have good database skills, be confident inwriting TSQL code and have some knowledge of the role of multidimensional databases in ananalytics environment.They will be participating in database design/analysis projects as well as working onparticular aspects of existing ETL routines and reports.
job_requirements: Qualifications:Education: Working towards a degree in Computer Science or equivalent.Experience with MS database management tools and MSâ€™s BI stack.Experience in database design, data modeling and database development desirable.Experience in data extraction, data analysis and data quality desirable.Skill Requirements of Position:The successful candidate must have the following qualifications and characteristics:Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills, and problem solving skillsPossess organizational, planning and analytical skillsCapable of working independently under time constraintsAbility to work well in multi-disciplinary teamsJob Characteristics:Complexity of Duties: Perform a range of project-related duties under minimal supervisionMust deal daily with changing priorities, and recognize and communicate priority conflictsWorks with a wide range of clients from other technical staff to business users.Unique Working Conditions: Deals with confidential information and would be required to sign a non-disclosure agreementTraining: On-the-job orientation providedPrimarily self-motivated for immediate activityEvaluation Criteria:1. Demonstrated interpersonal skills.2. Demonstrated understanding of database design.3. Demonstrated understanding of a range of MS data tools.4. Demonstrated writing/verbal communication skills and problem solving skills.5. Relevant experience (particularly in a project oriented environment).Open To All Majors:No
